title: Thunderbird hides last message
content:
I use Manjaro Linux distribution, stable branch. After the latest upgrade to TB 115 I started to have a problem with the message window - it hides the last message. I use the classic layout and in the window with all messages my latest messages are at the bottom. From the upgrade I need to scroll to the very last message every time as it is either partially or completely hidden.

Any idea if this can be somehow solved via configuration or is that a bug which needs to be fixed?

I tried to check the TB bugzilla but did not find anything there …

title: CalDav Authentication Caching Thunderbird 115.1.0
content: I have been synchronizing my calendars from Fastmail for a couple of years using App Passwords. Recently I upgraded to Thunderbird 115.1.0 and Thunderbird appears to have decided it would rather use an oAuth flow for CalDAV authentication. This would be fine, except the next time the calendars attempt to synchronize the authentication fails and the calendar is automatically disabled. I have not been able to find a way to go back to forcing app password authentication or to successfully retain oAuth authentication. Has anyone else run into this problem? Other potentially useful information: I'm running Debain Testing and Sway with Thunderbird installed from Debian repos. Downgrading to 102 restores expected behavior.

title: MOVING T-BIRD files to Win 10 from WIN 7, Getting WIN 10 to recognize e-mail accts.
content:
Hello, 

 Recently I had several comm. exchanges with David regarding moving my T-Bird files from this WIN 7 PC to my new Win 10 PC.  I was able to copy the THUNDERBIRD folder (in the Roaming folder) to a thumb drive.  I did the opposite steps on the WIN 10 PC.

When I open THUNDERBIRD (in the 10 PC), immediately a Google screen appears, asking to insert my password. I type the password in, which is VERY familiar to me, and I get an error message from Google stating that it is wrong. It is NOT wrong!!!!!! Furthermore, I have 4 e-mail addresses, but only the main one shows in the column on the left side of T-BIRD.

David suggested that I close the previous thread; he also suggested that the problem may be due to something called "OAUTH2". I have NO clue what this is or means, no clue how to go about investigating it. I've gone to local PC repair shops. They don't deal with THUNDERBIRD. I went to the local GEEK SQUAD outlet in a BEST BUY store, and they gave me similar stories. So!, I've been trying to move my T-BIRD data from this PC to the 10 since this past Christmas time, and so far have been unsuccessful. And, trying to get assistance from Google / Gmail is out of the question. H-E-L-P! Thank you. k.t.
creator: KARL_TAUSCHEN

title: Certain email accounts slow to send 115
content:
After a recent clean install of 115 I am having an issue that I am finding annoying. I have several email accounts Gmail, Aol, GMX and Sky.

When I write an email using GMX or Gmail, clicking send opens a 'sending' box which closes again almost immediately having sent straight away. However when I use Sky or AOL the 'sending box' stays open for between 20-25 seconds before its sent. Very irritating

I have tried the same Sky/Aol accounts in Windows mail and a trial version of Mailbird and they send instantaneously. So there are no issues with my setup or the network. I have read about mailnews.sendInBackground but not sure if this isnt just hiding a problem rather than fixing it.

Any suggestions as to a setting I could change or something else please.

title: Thunderbird filters
content:
I'm trying to set up message filters based on content in the message body. This works fine for plain text but if the body contains links, Thunderbird doesn't recognize text in the link and the filter fails. It seems the spammers have found a way around spam filters. Example follows:


W= rite to me on this website, as there won't be access to email for some ti= me <a href=3D"https://www.google.com/url?q=3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fspicymilfk.com= %2F%3Futm_source%3DyqeFGbFd%26utm_campaign%3Dren&sa=3DD&sntz=3D1&us= g=3DAOvVaw2_TfghNbVGVvflGYIc">Enigmatic Girl</a>

A filter for "Enigmatic Girl" works fine but I can catch hundreds more if I could filter on "spicymilfk". The body plain text changes but the URL doesn't. Is this a limitation? Is there some syntax that could pick it up? Thanks for any help.
creator: bobm5

title: Account can't log in to imap server
content: A Thunderbird email account which worked for years suddenly started sending the error message "Login to server imap.comcast.net with username rbhollimon@comcast.net failed"; no new email messages can be accessed by this account . The username and password have been carefully checked and appear to be correct. Another email account still works. No settings for the account were changed by us. A mobile phone has for years had access to this email account and messages could be read on the phone. The ability to read messages on the phone disappeared and attempts were made on the phone to restore the ability to read them. The login errors on Thunderbird began immediately after this onphone attempt. So far all attempts to fix this problem have failed. We need to restore the ability of this account to acquire new messages in order to preserve this email address. Any help with this problem will be greatly appreciated.
creator: bertorders

title: Comcast Outgoing Mail Server Setup
content:
I've used T'Bird for years. I have 6 Comcast e-mail addresses. I can receive e-mail on all of them.

BUT, maybe a month ago, maybe 2, I can now only send messages on ONE, my "main" C'Cast account. The one I sign in with @ xfinity.com, to manage all E addresses/accounts.

When send fails, I get a message saying:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Please ensure your email address and authenticating user match when sending messages. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.

So I dig into my T-Bird account settings. Each of the 6 addresses has individual settings on the "Incoming Server". When I look at "Outgoing Server", it's ONE setting (U/N & Pass) for ALL accounts", which has always been my Main CCast account! If I change one, they all change.

At Comcast, all E addresses use the same password, which is why it worked FLAWLESSLY for YEARS! Now, Comcast's server APPEARS to be looking for an INDIVIDUAL U/N & Pass for EACH address, which T-Bird appears to be NOT capable of doing.

Any recommendations??

Thanks & have a great day!!!
creator: g.vlasic

title: Thunderbird is laggy and locks up
content:
I experience, as man others in the forum, that T-Bird locks the cursor, and everything goes to a halt. You can actually keep typing, and most of the text will appear when the "lag is over". The issue started more than a year ago when I set up a new laptop with pre installed W10, so it was a blank installation of T-Bird. I fiddled a bit with the below registry settings, it primarily take care of resource eating nonsense from MS - it helped a bit, not much.

All this just to say, you have a problem at the T-Bird developer team, I'm not the only person reporting this, but support don't know their head from the tail.

I'm running WIN10 and have no plans of upgrading for now.

I'm not suspecting the computer which is a new one with an I7 processor and 16Gb RAM

================================================================

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\location] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\webcam] "Value"="Deny"
